newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Tabaqueira decision not discussed in cabinet.
newsitem.headline: Tabaqueira decision not discussed in cabinet.

text.p: The privatisation of Portuguese tobacco company Tabaqueira was not discussed by the cabinet and was not on the agenda of the next cabinet meeting on Thursday, a finance ministry source said.
"It is not on the agenda for Thursday, but that does not mean to say that it won't be discussed," the source told Reuters.
It was not immediately known if a decision on the winning bid had been formally delayed for any reason.
Economy Minister Augusto Mateus had said the winning bid was expected to be decided on Monday.

The three bidding groups are Spanish state-owned tobacco company Tabacalera, which is allied to Madeira company Empresa Madeirense de Tabacos, U.S. group Philip Morris Cos Inc, in partnership with the Jorge de Mello group, and French firm Seita (St Nationale d'Exploitation Industrielle des Tabacs et Allumettes).
